arts.ttl: Cifuentes savours QPR victory and gives update after yet more injuries
arts.sum: Marti Cifuentes savoured QPR’s vital win at Oxford United but insisted “the job is not done”. The 3-1 victory – Rangers’ first win in eight matches – took them seven points clear of the Championship relegation zone, on 49 points – one short of the 50-mark regarded as usually being enough to avoid the drop. arts.ttl: Oxford United v QPR player ratings
arts.sum: QPR won the six-pointer they badly needed to and moved to the verge of Championship safety. Here’s how we rated each Rangers player in the 3-1 victory at Oxford. Paul Nardi: 8 Mostly very well protected by his defence, but was faultless when called upon, producing a near-post save to deny Rúben Rodrigues and keeping […] The post Oxford United v QPR player ratings appeared first on West London Sport.

arts.ttl: QPR improve survival prospects at Oxford's expense
arts.sum: Min-Hyeok Yang struck in stoppage time to seal QPR's 3-1 victory at Oxford and a first win in eight games as they took a massive step towards Sky Bet Championship safety.

arts.ttl: QPR improve survival prospects at Oxford’s expense
arts.sum: The visitors were 3-1 winners at the Kassam Stadium on Wednesday.

arts.ttl: Oxford United v QPR line-ups: Bennie and Madsen start, Kolli a sub
arts.sum: Australian youngster Daniel Bennie has been given his first QPR start in tonight’s vital game in the battle for Championship survival. Bennie, usually a winger, was deployed up front when he came on as a substitute against Cardiff on Saturday because of Rangers’ lack of attacking options. arts.ttl: QPR boss admits he would rather not have to select Kolli
arts.sum: Marti Cifuentes admits he would rather not have to turn to Rayan Kolli for QPR’s vital game at Oxford United tonight. Forward Kolli, 20, is one of several Rangers players to have been unavailable because of injury. He recently returned to full training and is in the squad for the match at the Kassam Stadium.
